intro: Goodia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-seeded goodia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule containing numerous seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. Goodia macrocarpa is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
